Package jgame

Class World

java.lang.Object
jgame.World
public class World extends Object

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    World.Camera
    This class handles the position of the camera.
    class 
    World.Edge
    This is an Entity for checking collisions with World boundaries, via Entity.collisionWithType(World.Edge.class), or similar methods
    static enum 
    World.ZoomType
    A number of options for scaling the World to fill the window.

  • Method Details

    • setBackground

      public void setBackground(Paint bg)
      Sets the Paint to be used filling the parts of the window not covered by the World.

      Note that Color implements Paint
      Parameters:
      bg - The desired background paint

    • setFillPaint

      public void setFillPaint(Paint fill)
      Sets the Paint to be used when drawing the World

      Note that Color implements Paint
      Parameters:
      fill - The desired background paint

    • setFillSprite

      public void setFillSprite(Sprite fill)
      Sets a Sprite to be displayed when drawing the World. This sprite will be drawn centered at (0,0)
      Parameters:
      fill - The desired image

    • getBackgroundColor

      public Color getBackgroundColor()
      Returns the current background color
      Returns:
      The current background color

    • getBackgroundSprite

      public Sprite getBackgroundSprite()
      Returns the Sprite currently being used as a background image for this World
      Returns:
      The current background image

    • getAllOfType

      public <T extends Entity> List<T> getAllOfType(Class<T> type)
      Returns a list of all Entities in the world which extend the specified class.

      Example usage: If class Enemy extends Entity, all Enemies could be collected via
      List<Enemy> enemies = world.getAllOfType(Enemy.class)
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class to collect. Must be a subclass of Entity
      Parameters:
      type - The class to collect. Must be a subclass of Entity
      Returns:
      A List containing all the Entities in the world which are of class type or a subclass of type

    • add

      public void add(Entity e)
      Adds the specified Entity to the world at the point (0,0)
      Parameters:
      e - The Entity to add

    • add

      public void add(Entity e, double x, double y)
      Adds the specified Entity to the world at the specified point.
      Parameters:
      e - The Entity to add
      x - The Entity's pixel x position
      y - The Entity's pixel y position

    • remove

      public void remove(Entity e)
      Removes the specified Entity from the World
      Parameters:
      e - The Entity to remove

    • removeAll

      public void removeAll(Collection<Entity> e)
      Removes all specified Entities from the World
      Parameters:
      e - The Collection of Entities to remove

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Returns the JFrame this World is in.
      Returns:
      This world's host frame

    • pause

      public void pause(boolean hide)
      Pauses the World, so it no longer updates it's Entities, and if hide is true, hides the Entities until play() is called
      Parameters:
      hide - Whether to hide the entities until resume

    • play

      public void play()
      Resumes Entity updates and drawing

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns whether the World is sending updates to it's Entities
      Returns:
      Whether the world is running

    • convertToWorldCoordinates

      public Point convertToWorldCoordinates(Point p)
      Converts a Point on the window (such as from Controller.getMouse()) to a point in the World
      Parameters:
      p - The point to convert, relative to the window
      Returns:
      A point relative to the world

    • getMouse

      public Point getMouse()

    • setSize

      public void setSize(Dimension size)
      Sets the size of the world. A size of null will remove bounds for the world.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the world

    • getSize

      public Dimension getSize()
      Returns the size of the World. Note that this is not necessarily the size of the window.
      Returns:
      The size of the world, if one has been assigned, else null

    • setZoomType

      public void setZoomType(World.ZoomType zoom)
      Sets the World.ZoomType the world uses for scaling when the window is resized
      Parameters:
      zoom - The desired method for auto-zooming
